Article Title: 'I have also been through this': Chirag Paswan reacts to Rohini's exit from Lalu Yadav family; hopes tensions settle soon
Article Text:

NEW DELHI: RJD leader Rohini Acharya’s announcement that she is quitting politics, along with emotional allegations of humiliation and abuse by her own family, drew sympathy from Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan, who referenced his own experiences with personal crises while responding to the matter.On Saturday, Rohini declared that she was separating from both her family and the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD). A day later, she escalated her allegations, accusing her brother Tejashwi Yadav of humiliating and abusing her, claiming that the situation deteriorated to the point where “a slipper was raised to hit her.”In a post on X, she wrote, "Yesterday, a daughter, a sister, a married woman, a mother was humiliated, abuses were hurled, shoes were raised to kill her... I didn't compromise on my self-respect, didn't give up on truth... just because of this, I had to face insults. Yesterday, a daughter left her crying parents and siblings due to helplessness... she was forced to leave her parental home... she was made an orphan... I pray that none of you ever have to walk my path, and no house should have a daughter-sister like Rohini. "Speaking to reporters Sunday, Chirag Paswan said, "I will not make any comments on this because I can understand the mental status when a family goes through such a difficult situation.I have also been through this.”Paswan added that political differences have never affected his personal warmth toward Lalu Prasad Yadav’s children."We might have had political differences but I have always considered Lalu ji's family my own. Be it Tejashwi, Tej, Misa or Rohini, I have considered them my siblings," he said, as quoted by ANI."I pray that this family dispute is resolved at the earliest. If there is unity in the family, a person can fight tough situations outside. The family must be going through a tough situation," he added.Rohini’s public fallout comes on the heels of the RJD’s dramatic electoral collapse, with the Tejashwi-led party winning just 25 of 143 seats- a loss of more than 100 seats.Her brother Tej Pratap Yadav, who himself was expelled from both the Yadav family and the RJD a few months earlier, also reacted to the developments, warning those he called “traitors” and issuing an emotional appeal to his father, Lalu Prasad Yadav.
Article Summary: Rohini Acharya announced that she is leaving the Rashtriya Janata Dal. She accused her brother Tejashwi Yadav of humiliating and abusing her. Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan said he has been through personal crises.

Article Title: Nithari murders without murderers: The Surinder Koli saga isn’t over
Article Text:

Nithari killing victim Rimpa Haldar's parents Doli Haldar and Anil Haldar showing victory signs after the special court pronounced death sentence for Moninder Singh Pandher and his servant Surinder Koli in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh on February 14, 2009. (Times Content Image)

The Human Toll: A Ghost Killed Those Children?

A police bulldozer is used to uncover a drain to search for bodies, outside a house in Noida on the outskirts of New Delhi, on December 29, 2006. The police has arrested two men after recovering from a drain, parts of 15 skeletons of girls and boys behind an industrialist's house. The caretaker of the house Subhash alias Surendra reportedly told the cops he had been sexually abusing and strangulating his victims before disposing of their bodies in the drain. (Times Content Image)

The Culmination

The painful truths

Investigative systems can fail, especially when constrained by corruption, negligence, or lack of urgency.

Evidence matters, but how it's collected — and whether due process is followed — can make or break a case.

Confession is a double-edged sword: powerful, but only if obtained fairly and documented properly.





NOIDA/NEW DELHI: For years, the narrow lanes of Nithari whispered the same story: children vanished, one after another, swallowed by a darkness no one could name.Inside D-5, where life seemed ordinary from the outside, investigators later uncovered fragments of a nightmare scattered through drains, courtyards and rooms that refused to give up their truth.Two decades on, Nithari remains less a crime scene and more a wound — a place where every unanswered question still walks the streets.The Nithari case remains one of country's most chilling and controversial serial-killing episodes. It centers around Bungalow D-5 in Nithari village, Noida and involves two men — the homeowner, Moninder Singh Pandher and his domestic helper, Surinder Koli The macabre tale that unfolded over years involved skeletal remains in drains, allegations of rape, murder, necrophilia, and organ trading — and a deeply flawed investigation that has haunted the judicial process for nearly two decades.The nightmare began in May 2006, when Nand Lal , father of a 22-year-old woman named Payal (also known as Deepika), reported her missing.Payal had visited Pandher’s bungalow D-5 in Sector 31, Nithari, allegedly to talk about a job for her brother — but she never returned.It was later reported that Koli had called her from a public phone booth.Despite the serious nature of the disappearance, the police response was strikingly delayed.According to a former investigator (then sub-inspector, later DSP), no FIR was registered for months.It was only after a court application under Section 156(3) of the CrPC, filed by Nand Lal, that an FIR was formally lodged on October 7, 2006 — nearly five months after Payal vanished.Things took a horrifying turn on December 29, 2006, when investigators discovered eight skeletal remains in a roadside drain next to the D-5 bungalow.This grim find, lead to the arrest of both Koli and Pandher. Within days, more bone fragments were unearthed in and around the drainage system.The discovery shook the nation and exposed the full extent of what had been a series of missing persons — children and young women — in and around Nithari.The initial investigation by the Uttar Pradesh Police came under criticism almost immediately. According to the first investigator, crucial delays had allowed the case to spiral: The FIR was filed only after months of pressure, and formal search operations began six months too late.These early lapses, he said, sowed the seeds of deeper problems.By January 10, 2007, due to mounting public outrage and the scale of the horror, the case was handed over to the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI).Within days, CBI teams conducted intensive searches around the bungalow and adjoining areas, recovering more human remains — skulls, bone pieces and dismembered body parts.The sheer scale of recovered remains made it difficult even for the investigators to determine how many victims there might have been.In the early months of the investigation, charge sheets were filed in 16 cases, spanning accusations of murder, rape, abduction, criminal conspiracy, destruction of evidence and more.On March 1, 2007, Koli made a highly detailed recorded confession.He reportedly admitted to murdering six children and one woman. He described luring them into the bungalow, strangling them, sexually abusing the bodies, dismembering them and discarding the remains in drains.He also made claims of cannibalism, stating that he sometimes cooked and ate flesh from the victims.The case proceeded in a special CBI court in Ghaziabad, and on February 13, 2009, both Koli and Pandher were sentenced to death in the first case.The trial court would go on to deliver verdicts over many years, across multiple hearings, more than 2,000 hearings were held during this prolonged trial.Koli was eventually convicted in 13 cases by the trial court and awarded death sentences in all, though one of these was commuted to life imprisonment.In a later case (May 2022), a special CBI court awarded him another death sentence for the rape and murder of a woman.While the trial court’s judgments were gruesome and seemed to close the case, the story was far from over.On September 11, 2009, the Allahabad high court delivered a big verdict: While upholding Koli’s death sentence, it acquitted Pandher in at least one prominent case, citing “no evidence” against him.Over time, Koli’s legal team mounted a fierce appeal. On October 16, 2023, in a landmark decision, the Allahabad high court acquitted Koli in 12 of the death-sentence cases and Pandher in two, overturning the trial court’s verdicts.The court did not mince words: It stated that the investigation had been botched up and that “basic norms of collecting evidence were brazenly violated.”A particularly scathing point in the high court’s judgment was the failure to probe possible organ trade — an angle raised by a high-level committee from the Ministry of Women and Child Development.Investigators, the court said, “opted for the easy course” by pinning blame on Koli and demonising him, instead of exploring deeper and more alarming conspiracies.The court also questioned the credibility of Koli’s confession. It noted procedural irregularities: the confession was allegedly recorded 60 days into police remand, yet there was no medical examination or independent witness.Moreover, the court highlighted contradictions in prosecution testimony about where and when the confession was made.Recovery of skeletal remains, according to the court, came from a drain outside the boundaries of Pandher’s house — not from inside, as had often been claimed.Ultimately, the court declared that the guilt of Koli and Pandher had not been proved beyond reasonable doubt, particularly because the case rested largely on circumstantial evidence.The judgment drew sharp criticism from victim families, who saw it as a deep betrayal after nearly two decades of pursuing justice.Following the high court’s 2023 acquittal, Moninder Singh Pandher was released from Luksar Jail on October 20, 2023, after spending 14 years behind bars.Surinder Koli, meanwhile, was not immediately freed — he continued to serve a life sentence in a separate conviction.But his legal fight was not over.In July 2025, the Supreme Court upheld the Allahabad HC’s acquittal of Koli in the 12 previously overturned cases. The apex court ruled that police lapses had rendered crucial evidence inadmissible.Then, on November 11, 2025, in a decisive moment, the Supreme Court accepted Koli’s curative plea (his last judicial recourse), acquitted him in the final pending case (Rimpa Haldar case) and ordered his immediate release.The man once dubbed the “Nithari killer” has now been acquitted in all major Nithari murder cases.When word of his acquittal reached his barrack, Koli had remained seated for some time, staring at the floor. Then a faint smile crossed his face. “He was relaxed, and there was a smile on his face,” a senior jail official told TOI.While Koli did give a detailed confession, the courts later scrutinised the conditions of its recording, It came long into police custody, without independent witnesses, and with no medical examination — casting shadows on its voluntariness and authenticity.Perhaps most damning was the court’s assertion that organ trade – a horrifying, but plausible, motive – was not properly probed.The investigation, according to the HC, seemed to choose the less difficult path of blaming a single man rather than confronting possible organised crime.One sacked officer, Simranjeet Kaur was arrested by the CBI in 2007 for allegedly framing false records to protect Pandher and Koli, having received payments.The mysterious death of a key witness, Jatin Sarkar, whose daughter was among the missing. His body was later found in a pond in Bengal.Parents of missing children watched as time passed with no clear answers. The high court’s 2023 acquittals were met with “dejection” by many, signaling that legal closure did not equal emotional closure.The community around Nithari, once traumatised by the gruesome revelations, still remembers the D-5 bungalow as a somber landmark.The Supreme Court’s acquittal in the 13th, and final, case against Koli left the families devastated.A 63-year-old Jhabbu Lal and his wife Sunita (60) continued seeking justice for their daughter Jyoti — one of the children who went missing in 2006 and was later found among the Nithari victims.“I had six children, and the fifth was Jyoti. She went missing in 2006,” Lal recalled, his voice shaking. “Her body was later found in the drain outside house number D5 (Moninder Pandher's bungalow where Koli worked).”Lal spent decades fighting in courts, selling valuables and even a house in Sangam Vihar, Delhi, to fund the case.Lal said, “If he didn’t commit the crime, then who did? If he is freed, that means someone else killed our children. Why was Koli kept behind bars for so many years?”Sunita Lal added, “Even after all these years, the pain hasn’t faded. Every time I pass that bungalow, it feels like I’m standing at the same place where my world ended. We never got our child back — only the memories and a lifetime of waiting for justice.”Another mother of a deceased said "Moninder (Moninder Singh Pandher) and Surinder Koli, killed so many children. But the case is not being done anything about. Who is guilty now? Was there a ghost in that house which killed all children? They used to kill children and indulge in organ trafficking. Now they say that they are innocent. Law is letting them go; God won't."When the Supreme Court finally granted his curative petition in November 2025 and ordered his immediate release, it marked the end of a long, fraught journey.The ruling underscored deep flaws in the original investigation: procedural lapses, contested confessions and weak evidence.Moninder Pandher, too, walked free earlier when the high court acquitted him.It was noted that during his release in October 2023, Pandher was frail, battling health issues including tuberculosis.The bungalow D-5, once infamous, now lies overgrown and decaying — a ghostly testament to the violence that took place there.Even when courts finally render a verdict, emotional justice may remain elusive for victims and their families.The Nithari killings case, is more than a crime story; it is a mirror to systemic failures, a cautionary tale about investigative hubris, and a study in how the quest for justice can stretch over decades.The courtroom battles — convictions, acquittals and final release — have reshaped public memory of D-5 bungalow.But the wounds remain: for the families who lost children, for a village scarred by horror, and for a nation forced to reckon with how easily its systems can be outpaced by darkness.
Article Summary: The Nithari case remains one of country's most chilling and controversial serial-killing episodes. It centers around Bungalow D-5 in Noida and involves two men — the homeowner, Moninder Singh Pandher and his domestic helper, Surinder Koli. Investigators later uncovered fragments of a nightmare scattered through drains, courtyards and rooms that refused to give up their truth.

Article Title: Lalu pari-war: After Rohini, 3 more daughters walk out of Patna home
Article Text:
Picture from Facebook (File)

"I have no family..." Rohini Acharya Cuts Ties With Lalu Clan, Exits Politics Post-RJD Defeat

Insult meted out to my sister is intolerable: Tej Pratap

PATNA/NEW DELHI: RJD patriarch Lalu Prasad's daughter Rohini Acharya's outburst at her brother Tejashwi Yadav and his close associates for "abusing" and "throwing" her out of home is snowballing into a full-blown family feud and hints at increasing internal rumblings over the decisions of the party's anointed heir after its bid for office unravelled spectacularly in the assembly polls.As she dropped another bombshell on Sunday by saying she was dissed for donating her "dirty kidney" to Lalu and was accused of extracting crores of rupees and a Lok Sabha ticket, three of her sisters - Ragini, Chanda and Rajlakshmi - left their parents' Patna residence.Their brother Tej Pratap Yadav, disowned by his father and ousted from the party last year, spoke up against Rohini's "humiliation".Lalu, his younger son and political heir Tejashwi, and other family members have maintained silence, an indication of the division and conflicted emotions within. The party too has kept mum.Some party leaders suggested that differences among the siblings have long been simmering as Tejashwi took firmer control of the party and leaned on a set of advisers loyal to him to run its affairs. That arrangement has come up for questioning.But the Bihar assembly poll debacle has opened up this style of functioning to questioning. Rohini said everybody is wondering what fate has befallen RJD, a party that governed Bihar between 1990 and 2005.Tej Pratap said in a social media post, "Yesterday's incident has shaken me. But the insult meted out to my sister is intolerable."I tolerated whatever happened to me but her humiliation cannot be tolerated under any condition... The consequence of this injustice will be very dire."He accused 'Jaichands' (betrayers), widely believed to be a reference to a couple of Tejashwi's close associates, including Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Yadav, of targeting the Yadav family. Appealing to Lalu, he said, "Just one nod, and the people of Bihar will bury these Jaichands themselves. This fight is not for any party; it is for the honour of the family, the dignity of the daughter, and the self-respect of Bihar."As the family fallout played out, TV footage showed three more daughters of Lalu's reaching Patna airport with their children to catch a flight, reportedly for Delhi. None of them spoke to the media. Incidentally, their departure came hours after Rohini advised women to "look after your in-laws and families and take care of your children" rather than parents."I would tell all married women never to do anything to save their parents, and if they have a brother, they should ask him to donate his own kidney or ask his Haryanavi friend to do so," she said in an emotional post. She said she had committed a blunder by not obtaining permission from her husband and in-laws and not thinking about the future of her three children before donating a kidney to her father.Earlier, she alleged she was humiliated and abused, and a slipper was lifted to hit her. She said her parents, Lalu and Rabri Devi, both former CMs, were crying and blamed Sanjay Yadav and Rameez Nemat Khan, who hails from Uttar Pradesh and is said to be Tejashwi's friend, for her "fate".She named her brother too but directed most of her anger at his two associates.The developments followed RJD's disastrous performance in the just-held assembly elections in Bihar, in which the party could win only 25 seats after contesting 143. Tejashwi was officially projected as MGB's chief ministerial candidate.Meanwhile, the JD(U) asked Lalu to explain the developments and act. "She is the daughter of entire Bihar, then why are you silent, Lalu ji... Please break your silence," JD(U) spokesperson Neeraj Kumar said.
Article Summary: Rohini Acharya's outburst at her brother Tejashwi Yadav and his close associates is snowballing into a full-blown family feud. Three of her sisters - Ragini, Chanda and Rajlakshmi - left their parents' Patna residence. Tej Pratap Yadav spoke up against Rohini's "humiliation"

Article Title: Bihar results: RJD got more votes than BJP, JD(U) but fewer seats; here's why it happened
Article Text:
Tejashwi Yadav

‘Misa-Priyanka Ko Dickey Mein…’: Yashwant Deshmukh’s Message to RJD–Cong After NDA’s Bihar Win

High votes, low wins: The big contradiction



Contest more seats



NDA's math clicked, MGB's math cracked



JD(U)'s comeback flipped the story



BJP grows bigger than ever



MGB slipped because allies didn't deliver



Jan Suraaj and AIMIM changed the margins



So, what really happened?



NEW DELHI: Bihar's 2025 election results threw up a story full of surprises. Tejashwi Yadav 's RJD turned out to be the party with highest vote share in the state, yet it ended up with one of its lowest seat tallies ever. On the other hand, the NDA kept the power with landslide victory, clinching over 200 seats in 243-member assembly, keeping the Mahagathbandhan far from the seat of government.RJD recorded a vote share of around 23 percent, just few decimals down from 2020, when it got 23.11 and emerged as the largest party with 75 seats. But this time, that same level of popularity translated into just 25 seats. So the striking question is: how can a party get the most votes, yet finish with so few seats?The answer lies in how votes were spread. RJD seems to have polled a large number of second-position votes. It remained popular, but not with enough concentrated support in winning zones.In simple terms, RJD got votes but not victories. This is no surprise in India's electoral mechanism of 'First Past the Post System.'RJD contested 143 seats this time, the highest among all parties across both the NDA and the Mahagathbandhan. In the 2020 assembly elections, the Lalu-led party had fielded one more candidate, contesting 144 seats.Contesting widely helped the party accumulate more total votes, contributing to the highest vote share. But losing candidates also add to vote share totals.Meanwhile, BJP and JD(U) fought on 101 seats each. They contested fewer seats but converted their votes efficiently into victories. That is why their seat count shot up, even with a lower vote share than RJD.A major turning point this election was the return of Chirag Paswan's LJP (Ram Vilas) to the NDA camp. In 2020, the LJP had hurt the NDA's chances by cutting into its votes, but this time its support helped strengthen the alliance instead of splitting it.In the previous election, LJP (RV) was unhappy with the NDA's seat-sharing formula in Bihar. Even though it was part of the alliance at the Centre, Chirag Paswan chose to go solo in the state and contested 134 seats, which ended up damaging NDA numbers—especially Nitish Kumar 's JD(U).Similarly, Upendra Kushwaha's party contested 104 seats independently in 2020, further cutting into votes that could have benefitted the NDA.This time, with both LJP (RV) and Kushwaha’s RLM back in the NDA fold, the alliance appeared far more united, organised, and prepared. The result: NDA outperformed the Mahagathbandhan by a wide margin.One of the biggest turnarounds happened in seats where RJD and JD(U) were in direct fight.In 2020, RJD dominated these contests. But in 2025, JD(U) turned the tables and won 50 out of 59, almost wiping out RJD in head-to-head battles. JD(U)'s vote share also jumped from 15.39 percent in 2020 to 19.25 percent this time, helping it win 85 seats from the tally of 43 last time.RJD simply failed to see this drastic reversal coming.The BJP crossed 89 seats, its highest tally ever in Bihar, marking a historic leap for a party that once had almost no grassroots base or ideological legacy in the state. By staying aligned for years with "sushasan babu" and steadily expanding its footprint, the saffron party has now grown into Bihar's biggest political force.With this mandate, the BJP has effectively redrawn the political map of Bihar. It now sits at the centre of power, holding the strongest bargaining position in the alliance. For years, Nitish Kumar played the "big brother" to the BJP, but for the second election in a row, the BJP has outperformed the JD(U), this time doing so with its best-ever numbers.The shift isn't just about arithmetic -- it's psychological. For decades, Bihar's political story revolved around the Lalu–Nitish axis. Today, it revolves around the BJP’s weight, influence and negotiating power.Unlike NDA, the Mahagathbandhan struggled with coordination and clarity.Congress contested on 61 seats as compared to last time's 70, but won only six. The Left parties, which surprised everyone in 2020, could not repeat their performance either. Seat-sharing disagreements and confusing "friendly fights" meant votes did not transfer smoothly within the alliance.The opposition was visible but not united -- and unity decides tight contests.Prashant Kishor's much-talked about startup -- Jan Suraaj did not open its account, but it made a strategic dent, in at least 35 seats, its vote share was higher than the winning margin, influencing outcomes for both alliances.Meanwhile, AIMIM repeated its strong Seemanchal performance, winning five seats with 1.85 percent of votes and signalling a shift in political thinking among Muslim voters.The traditional Muslim–Yadav (MY) vote base of the RJD showed signs of fragmentation, with Muslim voters exploring alternative platforms in multiple constituencies, leading to a near wipeout of the Mahagathbandhan in Seemanchal, barring one Congress candidate who scraped through.Mayawati's BSP also registered a presence, securing 1.62% of the total vote share with one seat in the west.RJD did not lose popularity, but lost positional advantage. It remained a strong choice for many voters but could not cross the finishing line often enough. High vote share created the impression of strength, but seats reflect actual power -- and that is where NDA towered above everyone.
Article Summary: RJD recorded a vote share of around 23 percent, just few decimals down from 2020. But this time, that same level of popularity translated into just 25 seats. RJD seems to have polled a large number of second-position votes, but not with enough concentrated support in winning zones.

Article Title: Bihar election results: In 35 seats, Prashant Kishor's party tally more than win margin
Article Text:
Kishor would at best be a spoiler, many of his critics had said

‘Nitish Still X-Factor’ Pavan Verma Decodes Why Jan Suraaj Couldn’t Break Through in Bihar Polls

Kishor would at best be a spoiler, many of his critics had said

NEW DELHI: Prashant Kishor 's Jan Suraaj Party lost its deposit in 236 of the 238 seats that it contested but data suggests it may have played spoiler in quite a few seats. In 35 constituencies, the party's votes were higher than the winning margin. NDA won 19 of these seats while 14 went to Mahagathbandhan. AIMIM and BSP each won one of these seats.Of course, the fact that Jan Suraaj got more votes than the margin in a seat does not necessarily mean it made the difference to the outcome since there is no way of knowing where those votes would otherwise have gone.The party came third in 115 seats and in one, Marhaura, it finished second.Of the 35 seats, within NDA, JDU, Kishor's former party, won 10 of these seats while BJP won five. The tally was three for LJP-RV and one for RLM.In the MGB camp, RJD was the winner in nine of these seats while Congress won two. One seat each went to CPM, CPIML-L and IIP.Despite his amplified presence on the social media, many critics of the party had claimed that Prashant Kishor would at best be a spoiler.Some felt his upper caste identity meant he would cut into BJP's vote while others argued he would divide the anti-incumbency youth votes since he was talking about issues like migration from the state.
Article Summary: In 35 constituencies, the party's votes were higher than the winning margin. NDA won 19 of these seats while 14 went to Mahagathbandhan. Jan Suraaj came third in 115 seats and in one, Marhaura, it finished second.

Article Title: 'Abuses hurled, slipper raised': Lalu Yadav family feud intensifies; Rohini Acharya alleges insult over kidney transplant
Article Text:
Rohini Acharya (PTI photo)

Also read:

Also read:

‘Misa-Priyanka Ko Dickey Mein…’: Yashwant Deshmukh’s Message to RJD–Cong After NDA’s Bihar Win

NEW DELHI: Lalu Prasad Yadav 's daughter, Rohini Acharya, who announced her separation from both her family and the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) on Saturday, has now levelled fresh and explosive allegations against her brother and party leader Tejashwi Yadav . Just a day after declaring she was distancing herself, Rohini accused Tejashwi of humiliating and abusing her, claiming that matters escalated to the point where "a slipper was raised to hit her. "Taking to X, Rohini wrote an emotional post, stating she was forced to leave behind her aged parents, Lalu Prasad Yadav and Rabri Devi - in tears while protecting her dignity. She posted writing in Hindi, which translates to: "Yesterday, a daughter, a sister, a married woman, a mother was humiliated, filthy abuses were hurled at her, a slipper was raised to hit her. I did not compromise on my self-respect, I did not surrender the truth, and solely because of this, I had to endure this insult. Yesterday, a daughter, out of compulsion, left behind her crying parents and sisters and came away; they tore me away from my maternal home. They left me orphaned. May none of you ever walk my path, may no family ever have a daughter-sister like Rohini."In a second post, Rohini referred to her kidney donation to her father in 2022 while alleging that personal and offensive remarks were made about it. She wrote that she was taunted for having "put a filthy kidney" into her father and accused of having "taken millions of rupees and bought a ticket" for the transplant.She further posted, "If there’s a son or brother in your parents’ home, then… tell your brother to get a kidney transplant from himself or his Haryanvi mates instead. "Rohini also wrote, "All you sisters and daughters, look after your own home and family… without a thought for your parents… with me, it was a massive sin to not look after my family or my three children, to not get permission from my husband or my in-laws before donating… which today has been branded as filthy."A day earlier, Rohini had already shocked RJD supporters by alleging, "I have no family. You can go and ask this to Sanjay Yadav, Rameez, and Tejashwi Yadav. They are the ones who threw me out of the family."This public fallout comes right after the RJD's historic electoral collapse, where the Tejashwi-led party in this election secured only 25 out of 143 seats, losing over 100 seats.This is not the first fracture within the family. Months ago, Lalu expelled his elder son Tej Pratap Yadav from the party. Tej Pratap went on to launch his own party, Janshakti Janata Dal (JJD), contesting from Mahua, only to lose by a massive margin, with his party failing to make a mark.
Article Summary: Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter, Rohini Acharya, announced her separation from both her family and the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) on Saturday. She has now levelled fresh and explosive allegations against her brother and party leader Tejashwi Yadav. Rohini accused her brother of humiliating and abusing her, claiming that matters escalated to the point where "a slipper was raised to hit her"

Article Title: FIR against Amit Thackeray, 70 MNS workers
Article Text:
Amit Thackeray (in black)

NAVI MUMBAI: Nerul police have filed an FIR against Amit Thackeray , the son of MNS chief Raj Thackeray and 70 MNS workers including office bearers for defying police prevention and forcibly unveiling the statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in a canopy constructed by NMMC at a junction in sector -1, Nerul near Rajiv Gandhi flyover on Sunday afternoon.The accused have been booked under relevant sections of BNS for assault or criminal force against a public servant, voluntarily causing hurt to a public servant in the discharge of their duty, unlawful assembly, rioting, joint liability and mischief causing loss or damage to property along with relevant sections of Maharashtra Police Act. As the cloth used to cover the statue had become dirty, it was indeed desecration of the statue of Maratha king. Hence, Amit Thackeray took the lead to unveil the statue and himself washed the statue."NMMC has released a presser stating that, the unveiling the statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in Nerul was not done by NMMC. Actually, the construction work around the statue has not been completed yet and is in the final stages. Therefore, the ceremonial installation of the statue was to be announced soon. Unveiling the statue without taking permission from the concerned authority and without giving any prior notice is very wrong and unauthorized from the point of view of law and order.

Article Title: How Kenny Easley died: Everything we know about the Hall of Famer’s passing and health struggles
Article Text:

When news broke that Seattle Seahawks legend Kenny Easley had passed away at 66, the NFL world felt the shock instantly. Fans, former teammates, and Hall of Fame members all reacted with the same heavy silence because the Enforcer wasn’t just a player. He was a presence. And now that voice is gone.Easley died on November 14, 2025, according to confirmations from the Pro Football Hall of Fame and his family. But one crucial detail remains unknown: no cause of death has been released.And that mystery has left many revisiting the long, difficult health journey that shaped Easley’s life long after he left the field.But what we do know is this: no official source has linked his death to any past health condition. Until the family or medical authorities release more information, the cause of death remains undisclosed.This silence has left fans wondering especially because Easley had a well-documented medical history that dramatically changed the course of his life.Long before his Hall of Fame induction, Easley suffered through one of the toughest medical battles an athlete can face.In the late 1980s, he was diagnosed with idiopathic nephrotic syndrome, a severe kidney disorder that ultimately ended his NFL career at just 28 years old.At the time, it shocked the league, he was in his prime, playing at an elite level, and widely considered one of the greatest safeties of his generation.The situation grew more painful when Easley later revealed the underlying cause. In a lawsuit, he claimed that excessive ibuprofen use, a common pain-management routine in the NFL had worsened his kidney failure.His life quickly turned into a medical fight:Even after the transplant, he carried the weight of that diagnosis for decades. Easley’s medical battles didn’t stop with the kidney transplant.In 2016, he underwent triple-bypass heart surgery, another major challenge that could have easily knocked him down. But in true Kenny Easley fashion, he bounced back, showing up for Seahawks events, supporting charitable causes, and remaining a powerful voice in the Seattle community.But even then, he stayed private about his health. And that privacy continues today, with his family choosing not to release the cause of death.His death at 66 leaves behind unanswered questions, yes. But it also leaves behind an undeniable legacy, a reminder that greatness doesn’t always last long, but it always lasts loud.
Article Summary: Easley died on November 14, 2025, according to confirmations from the Pro Football Hall of Fame and his family. No official source has linked his death to any past health condition. Oscar Piastri is watching his 2025 Formula 1 title hopes fade as his lead over teammate Lando Norris has fully disappeared. Earlier in the season, Oscar Piastri was ahead by 34 points. This swing happened after the summer break, and it has placed the young Australian under heavy pressure during an important part of the season.Lando Norris has been very strong since the break. On the other hand, Oscar Piastri hasn't stepped onto the podium since Monza, six races ago. Including Valtteri Bottas's comments, this disparity has sparked several paddock talks.Valtteri Bottas spoke about Oscar Piastri’s situation this week and showed strong support. He told 7News Adelaide that he knew the feeling well from his time racing with Lewis Hamilton at Mercedes between 2017 and 2021.Valtteri Bottas said, “I’ve been there. Been there, mate. It’s a tough sport.It’s not a fair sport. Sometimes you just deal with it. Oscar has so much time ahead of him. He has a great career ahead. Sometimes you need patience.”Valtteri Bottas also talked to CODE Sports, saying he still hopes Oscar Piastri can win the 2025 title. He said, “I am rooting for him for the title. He still has a chance.”Including the Qatar Grand Prix, which has a Sprint Race with eight bonus points, Oscar Piastri has three race weekends remaining to narrow the 24-point margin. Just 25 points behind Oscar Piastri, Max Verstappen is also battling for second in the championship.Former Haas head Guenther Steiner also offered Oscar Piastri some harsh words. He suggested Oscar Piastri quit McLaren if he is unable to return better following this year.Guenther Steiner said Oscar Piastri faced “mysterious problems” during the American races and had to change parts of his driving style.Also Read: Olympic Legend Surya Bonaly Loses All Her Medals To Las Vegas Thieves While Caring For Her Cancer-Stricken Mother Steiner said Oscar Piastri must reset over the winter or think about switching teams.The next race is the Las Vegas Grand Prix, where McLaren struggled in 2024. Article Title: New Orleans Pelicans cut ties with Willie Green after a brutal 2-10 collapse
Article Text:
(Image Source - Getty Images)

New Orleans Pelicans front office ends Willie Green’s tenure hours after reviewing the team’s direction





The New Orleans Pelicans made a clear and firm decision when they fired Willie Green only hours after a 118-104 home loss to the Los Angeles Lakers on November 14. The move came after a start that did not meet the standards of a team coming off a 49-33 season. New Orleans opened 0-6 and became the first team in NBA history to lose three of its first six games by at least 30 points. The team also allowed 120 points or more in each of its first five games, marking the worst defensive opening in franchise history.These results left little room for interpretation. The performance level was not close to what the roster was built for, and the front office responded. Willie Green addressed the pressure earlier in the season and spoke about staying focused on the players, but the issues remained the same across multiple games. If you look at how the season went, the firing was based strictly on the on-court product and the urgent need to change direction. The Pelicans acted decisively because the stats from the early weeks supported a major adjustment.Pelicans Executive Vice President of Basketball Operations Joe Dumars delivered the news in a statement released by the team on Saturday morning. "After careful evaluation, we have made the difficult decision to make a change at head coach," Dumars said in the official announcement.He added, "I have the utmost respect for Willie Green, and I’m sincerely appreciative of his contributions to the Pelicans organization and the New Orleans community. We wish him and his family all the best in the future."Team owner Gayle Benson backed the move in a separate statement issued the same day. "I have tremendous admiration and respect for Willie Green, and I truly appreciate all he has done for our organization over the last few years," Benson said. "This is a tough business and these are difficult decisions."In a recent interview prior to the firing, Benson had expressed urgency about the team's direction, "We need to improve immediately. Our roster is built for success right now." She also reiterated her confidence in Dumars, stating, "I really like Willie Green, but I hired Joe Dumars to assess our basketball operation. And that’s what he is doing."Dumars had previously defended retaining Green after a disappointing 21-61 finish in the 2024-25 season, the second-worst record in franchise history for an 82-game campaign. Speaking to media in May 2025, Dumars said, "I'm looking forward to going forward and working with Willie and to push us to success. You've got to set the bar. And that's what we're going to do." He focused on the desired style of play, adding, "The style of play — resilience, toughness, playing hard, never quit — that’s what we want people to see right away. "The New Orleans Pelicans were done hoping the same approach would fix itself. Willie Green had four-plus seasons and two playoff runs, but the early problems kept repeating. Add injuries to Zion Williamson and Dejounte Murray, and the team looked stuck again. Putting James Borrego in charge is their attempt to wake the roster up before the season gets even harder to recover from.Also Read: Stephen Curry seen rocking Nike just a day after ending his Under Armour partnership in a match against San Antonio Spurs
Article Summary: New Orleans Pelicans front office ends Willie Green's tenure hours after reviewing the team’s direction. The move came after a start that did not meet the standards of a team coming off a 49-33 season. New Orleans opened 0-6 and became the first team in NBA history to lose three of its first six games by at least 30 points.

Her outfit for the primetime matchup was far from her usual Patriots-themed style, which made fans even more curious as she revealed the story behind it.Maye threw for 281 yards, added a touchdown, and scrambled for 26 more as New England secured a 27-14 win against a struggling Jets team. The temperature at Gillette Stadium dropped into the low 40s, and that alone shaped Ann’s look. She has become a familiar presence at Patriots games, often going all-in on team colors, whether in bright red or deep New England blue. Her near-wardrobe mishap from a previous outing had already made headlines, and her growing popularity on social media, especially on her cooking TikTok, has only amplified the attention around her game-day fits.For the TNF game, Ann Maye ditched the Patriots palette and chose warmth over theme, telling fans in her TikTok video, “It’s cold, so we are working with what we got.” She followed it up with another candid line that fans immediately latched onto: “I know it’s brown and brown like has nothing to do with the Patriots, but I think it’s going to be really warm and I think it’s going to be a fun statement winter coat.”She showcased the look from the stadium, proving that practicality can still stand out. With New England now sitting at 9-2 and eyeing a playoff run that could stretch deep into January, staying warm will only get more important. Fans are already wondering what Ann might choose once true winter hits and the stakes rise even higher.Drake and Ann’s story has long been part of their charm. The couple met in middle school, both attended UNC, and even shared connections on the field through Ann’s brother Tad, who played quarterback with Maye. Their June 2025 wedding marked a new chapter, and today Ann stands as his strongest Patriots supporter, even when she leaves the team colors at home.
Article Summary: Drake Maye and the New England Patriots beat the New York Jets 27-14 on Thursday night. Maye's wife Ann wore a different outfit than her usual Patriots-themed outfit. The couple met in middle school, both attended UNC, and even shared connections on the field.

Article Title: Jack Hughes’ surprising 'non-hockey' hand injury at team dinner raises urgent questions for Devils fans
Article Text:
Devils rocked as Jack Hughes suffers shocking ‘non-hockey’ hand injury during team dinner outing (Getty Images)

Jack Hughes' injury puts Devils' momentum and Olympic hopes in spotlight



More NHL coverage

New Jersey Devils fans woke up to news they did not expect. Star forward Jack Hughes is out with a “non-hockey” hand injury, the team confirmed on Friday, Nov. 14. The announcement caught everyone by surprise because Hughes has been one of the brightest players in the league this season and a major reason behind New Jersey’s strong start. The team said he was still being evaluated and that “more details would be provided when they become available,” leaving the situation open to worry and speculation.Reports soon painted a clearer, yet stranger, picture. According to Sportsnet insider Elliotte Friedman, the injury happened during a team dinner on Thursday night. ESPN called it a “freak accident,” and early information suggests Hughes slipped and cut his hand. It may sound small, but the cut is serious enough to keep him out for at least one game. As odd as it seems, the dinner reportedly included Barstool Sports personality Frank “The Tank” Fleming, based on a social media post. That twist only added to the buzz around the incident.The timing of the Jack Hughes injury could not be more frustrating for New Jersey. Hughes has been electric this season, producing a team-high 10 goals and 20 points in 17 games for the Eastern Conference leaders.It is the strong comeback the team hoped for after he needed season-ending shoulder surgery last March. That injury came after he crashed into the boards, ending what had already been a disrupted stretch in which he missed 20 games in each of the previous two seasons.At 24, Hughes is entering his prime, and his play reflects that. He posted a team-record 99 points in 2022-23 and is widely considered a lock for Team USA’s Olympic roster. Any setback now raises questions not just for the Devils but also for his international plans. If the cut is deep or slow to heal, it could shift timelines the team had counted on.For now, the Devils and their fans must wait. The situation may have started as a rare accident at dinner, but its impact could linger far longer than the moment it happened.
Article Summary: New Jersey Devils forward Jack Hughes is out with a ‘non-hockey’ hand injury. The injury happened during a team dinner on Thursday night. ESPN called it a “freak accident,” and early information suggests Hughes slipped and cut his hand.

Article Title: Wayne Gretzky drops bold statement on Connor Bedard, hinting he’s destined for Team Canada spotlight
Article Text:
Wayne Gretzky praises Connor Bedard (Getty Images)

Connor Bedard continues to earn praise from Wayne Gretzky





Wayne Gretzky LOVES what he's seeing from Connor Bedard | NHL on TNT

More

NHL news

The Chicago Blackhawks walked away from their overtime loss to the New Jersey Devils with more than a single point. They walked away with another reminder that Connor Bedard is growing into something rare. Even in a game where Chicago gave up three separate one-goal leads, Bedard still found a way to shape the night. His early strike set the tone and kept the Blackhawks in a fight they were never fully out of. On a roster missing Frank Nazar, Jason Dickinson, and Andre Burakovsky, his presence mattered even more.Spencer Knight also played a key role, turning away chance after chance to keep Chicago steady. But it was Bedard who delivered the first spark. He opened the scoring on a well-earned 5-on-3 advantage created through persistence, smart puck movement, and hard work along the boards. A sharp give-and-go with Teuvo Teravainen pulled Jacob Markstrom out of position long enough for Bedard to finish. It was another example of how quickly he can change a game.That goal pushed Bedard to four straight games with a goal and nine straight with at least one point. With 26 points, he now sits tied for second in league scoring alongside Leo Carlsson and Macklin Celebrini.His rise has caught national attention, but it was a comment on TNT that carried the most weight."He's been absolutely spectacular." Wayne Gretzky said of Bedard. "It's such a pleasure to see because coming into this league at 18, you [have] all this pressure on you, you [have] all of this focus on you, you're not a very good team, you're a young team, you're rebuilding. He was front and center; he didn't back away from anybody or shy away from the media. For him to work as hard as he did in the off-season to come in and play at the level he's playing at now, he's earning his way onto Team Canada. "When The Great One speaks that strongly, people listen. Gretzky went out of his way to mention Team Canada, suggesting he believes Bedard not only belongs but is carving out a clear path. With the pace he is setting, leaving him off would feel impossible.Gretzky later compared Bedard’s scoring play to a Larry Bird no-look pass, a nod to the creativity behind the goal. More eyes will be on him soon as Chicago heads into a Hockey Night in Canada matchup with the Toronto Maple Leafs, and the praise is only expected to grow.
Article Summary: Wayne Gretzky says Connor Bedard is "absolutely spectacular" Bedard has scored in four straight games and has nine in a row with at least one point. He is tied for second in league scoring with Leo Carlsson and Macklin Celebrini. The Blackhawks lost 3-2 to the New Jersey Devils in overtime.

Article Title: NHL Trade Rumors: Could GM Stan Bowman push Edmonton Oilers toward a Juuse Saros deal?
Article Text:
Could GM Stan Bowman push Edmonton Oilers toward a Juuse Saros deal? (Image Via Twitter)

Can Edmonton Oilers actually convince the Nashville Predators to trade Juuse Saros?

“Absolutely Dynamic”: 55 Minutes of Juuse Saros Saves





At the beginning of their season, the goaltending dilemma at the Edmonton Oilers turned out to be their most important story, particularly after the humiliating 9-1 loss to the Colorado Avalanche. That loss led fans and analysts to push for GM Stan Bowman to take action immediately, and now he is under a lot of pressure to consider upgrading the goaltender position. Stuart Skinner has managed to perform better recently, and so he has received some support, but the conversation concerning if Juuse Saros could be the long-term answer still reigns in the league discussions.Interest in Saros rose when Jeff Marek first floated his name as a possible target, then insiders like Allan Mitchell and Mark Spector followed up with more detailed analyses. The biggest problem is clear: Edmonton is very close to the salary cap limit, has almost no tradable players, and Saros has only just begun the first year of an eight-year contract that carries a full no-movement clause. This situation makes any trade incredibly difficult, despite the fact that most people think that Saros would quickly bring stability to the Oilers’ most vulnerable area.The first question is whether Nashville wants to discuss things.Until now, the insider's view of the situation is that the Predators are not interested in trading Juuse Saros. Allan Mitchell mentioned that any trade would see the Nashville team retaining some salary, and allowing it to take back several players, whereas, in the case of Skinner, Frank Seravalli was not sure if Saros’ recent performance could be considered an upgrade over Skinner.The Pittsburgh Penguins, meanwhile, are figuring out how their narrative is changing. Insiders, like Josh Yohe, are saying that after the team’s surprisingly good start, players like Erik Karlsson, Rickard Rakell, and Bryan Rust are no longer going to be trade candidates — at least not as long as the team stays in the playoffs. GM Kyle Dubas will not be chasing risky rentals or sacrificing future assets, which implies he is adopting a more conservative approach compared to the previous seasons.The Oilers can only have Juuse Saros in their dreams for the moment, as all indications are that this trade is unlikely to happen — at least for now. Nashville wants to keep its goalie, and Edmonton has no room under the cap, making it more probable that the latter's next step will be aiming at a backup strengthening rather than going for a spectacular blockbuster trade.More coverage on NHL
